intro: Eupatorium tatamense, commonly known as the Japanese feverfew, is a perennial herb native to East Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in wetlands, stream banks, and other damp habitats. Its name "tatamense" refers to its origin in Japan, where it is used in traditional medicine.
